elements.label: The Continental
elements.description: 'Allez - cut them down and press forward. I have an appointment to keep.'

elements.label: The Warmaker
elements.description: 'COWARDS! Come and face me! Any man who dies at my hands dies a hero!'

elements.label: The Iron-Eater
elements.description: 'Stand, run, beg - it doesn't matter. There is no deliverance from me.' [The Iron-Eater will sometimes target Enemies on the board, but wounds he inflicts will instantly become Debilitations.]

elements.label: The Continental
elements.description: 'Allez - cut them down and press forward. I have an appointment to keep.'

elements.label: The Warmaker
elements.description: 'COWARDS! Come and face me! Any man who dies at my hands dies a hero!'

elements.label: The Iron-Eater
elements.description: 'Stand, run, beg - it doesn't matter. There is no deliverance from me.' [The Iron-Eater will sometimes target Enemies on the board, but wounds he inflicts will instantly become Debilitations.]

elements.label: Contemplation: The Warmaker
elements.description: Places of fiercest battle beckon the Edge-Long like blood beckons sharks. Going unseen in the armies of the nations, they cut swathes across the continents to reach their ordained nemeses. The Warmaker, then, is not directly our enemy, but he will not refuse a chance to try his strength against an army in his path. Is there a way we can rid ourselves of him?

elements.label: Contemplation: The Warmaker's Dyad
elements.description: All Edge-Long are but one half of an Edge dyad: a partnership of two immortals, locked together in eternal combat and eternal striving. Perhaps that is something that interests us. The Warmaker's nemesis must be on the front somewhere - if we want to be rid of him, seeking out his enemy may be a prudent first step.

elements.label: Contemplation: Warmaker and Continental
elements.description: She was the Warmaker's comrade against the British, once, under the sun of the New World. Perhaps she was also his lover. But she returned to France when the Corsican named himself emperor, and offered her sword up in service to him. Seven wars were then fought in twelve years between France and the rest of Europe, and the Continental went dutifully with her blades against the British, the Russians, the Austrians - and against the Warmaker. She bitterly proclaimed it was her duty; the Warmaker disagreed. And more than a hundred years later, they disagree still.

elements.label: Contemplation: The Iron-Eater
elements.description: Places of fiercest battle beckon the Edge-Long like blood beckons sharks. Going unseen in the armies of the nations, they cut swathes across the continents to reach their ordained nemeses. The Iron-Eater, then, is not directly our enemy, but he will not spare any man or woman who happens to be in his way. Is there a way we can rid ourselves of him?

elements.label: Contemplation: The Iron-Eater's Dyad
elements.description: All Edge-Long are but one half of an Edge dyad: a partnership of two immortals, locked together in eternal combat and eternal striving. There is very little that might halt a dyad mid-battle, caught up in their hatreds and passions as they tend to be. Perhaps that is something that interests us. The Iron-Eater's nemesis must be on the front somewhere - if we want to be rid of him, seeking out his enemy may be a prudent first step.

elements.label: Contemplation: Iron-Eater and Orphan
elements.description: On a winter's night in the Old Rus, the Iron-Eater created the boy who would become his great enemy. Was it curiosity that convinced him to spare the child, even after butchering his family? Apathy? Perhaps he himself has forgotten. In time, however, the boy came to be the ward of a host of monks, and was raised by hymnal and fasting and prayer. But in his heart, the boy only ever prayed for one thing. He never got it - and three hundred years later, when Red fought White on the slopes of Old Rus, the Iron-Eater sent the Orphan to join the rest of his family.

elements.label: An Opening?
elements.description: An Edge-Long's defence is nearly impenetrable. Nearly.

elements.label: Memory: A Union of Enmities
elements.description: The Warmaker is now engaged with his immortal enemy, the Continental. Busy as they are trying to kill one another, I doubt I will see either of them again. [No Edge-Long will come to attack you.]
